Site requires a free registration and login, and all information except company number and status (registered) must be purchased for ~EUR 5.80; filings from a range of dates are available but must be purchased separately. corporate_registry.wiki_content:
===Firmenbuch===

* [https://www.firmenbuch.at/ Company Register Austria (Firmenbuch)] for searching Commercial Registers and Companies (''pub'')

* [http://www.firmenabc.at Firmenabc] - A quick and free solution for company information, though not always 100% up to date (''pub'')

The Austrian National Enterprise Register, known as the Firmenbuch, is accessible online. It provides comprehensive data on all registered companies in Austria, including company name, legal form, registration number, and details on directors and shareholders. The search engine supports queries by company name, registration number, and director name.

For Austrian small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), the corporate registry (Firmenbuch) historically provided access to various corporate information. This included details about board members, financial statements, and ownership structures, essential for conducting detailed corporate research. The change in regulation post-RÄG 2014 reduced the amount of disclosed information for smaller entities. Medium and large companies are still subject to more comprehensive disclosure requirements. They must publicly disclose their financial reports and subsidiaries, adhering to stricter transparency regulations. This ensures that larger entities remain accountable and transparent regarding their corporate governance and financial status.

Prior to the Rechnungslegungsänderungsgesetz 2014 (RÄG 2014) that came into effect in 2016, even small companies (those not classified as mittelgroße or große under Austrian law) were required to publicly disclose their subsidiaries. This regulation changed, and small companies were no longer obligated to publicly disclose their subsidiaries, impacting transparency regarding ownership and corporate structure post-2016. This means corporate structures are sometimes available in archived corporate records from before then even for these entities!

====Privatstiftung====

Privatstiftungen are private foundations established under Austrian law, primarily used for asset management, estate planning, and sometimes charitable purposes. These entities often own assets indirectly through subsidiaries and do not typically disclose financial statements or returns publicly. This structure provides a level of financial opacity, allowing ultimate beneficial owners (UBOs) to maintain a degree of anonymity and privacy in their financial dealings.

Austrian Privatstiftungen can have complex structures, often involving international holdings. These foundations may have wholly-owned subsidiaries in various countries, with significant investments in properties and other assets. The names of the board members of the Privatstiftung are publicly available, but the beneficiaries and specific financial details are usually not disclosed in Austrian records, adding another layer of confidentiality.

===Commercial Court Registry Database===

* [https://www.justiz.gv.at/ Commercial Court Database] - maintained by the Austrian judiciary, provides access to detailed company filings for a fee. Available documents include KBIS Extracts, which provide detailed company information such as full names and addresses of directors, and historical filings including changes in share capital and ownership. (''pub'')

* [https://justizonline.gv.at/jop/web/firmenbuchabfrage Official site providing limited company] information for free (''pub'')

===Commercial Gazette Records===

* [https://www.wienerzeitung.at/ Wiener Zeitung] - publishes official announcements that companies are required to make on changes made, including changes in ownership, registration, and other significant corporate events. (''priv'')

* [https://www.firmenmonitor.at Commercial courts company announcements] - includes director and shareholder names and liquidation notices (''pub'')

===Additional Registry Resources===

* [https://www.firmenbuchgrundbuch.at Austrian commercial register - authorized] reseller providing access to company data including name, address, legal form, share capital, representatives, and owners (''paid'')

* [https://portal.zedhia.at/ Central European economic and company] history database containing data on companies registered since 1991 and selected prior corporate filings

* [http://www.austriayp.com Unofficial business directory] 

* [https://www.firmenabc.at/ Business database providing full ownership] details for free for some entities (''pub'')

* [https://e-justice.europa.eu/iri/int EU Interconnected Insolvency Register for] searching insolvent entities or individuals (''pub'')

* [https://www.wienerborse.at/ Vienna Stock Exchange] (''pub'')

* [https://firmen.wko.at Austrian Economic Chambers] (''pub'')

* [https://edikte.justiz.gv.at/edikte/edikthome.nsf EU Interconnected Insolvency Register for] Austria (''pub'')

* [https://www.manz.at/wir_ueber_uns/agb/impressum.html Austria Commercial Register] (''pub'')

* [https://beta.e-justice.europa.eu/106/EN/business_registers_in_eu_countries?AUSTRIA&member=1 European Commission E-Justice overview of] Austrian business registry (''pub'')

* [http://en.wienerborse.at/investors/listedcompanies/ Vienna Stock Exchange listed companies] information (''pub'')

===Address Verification===

The primary address of individuals can be verified by Austrian residents through ID Austria.

* [https://citizen.bmi.gv.at/at.gv.bmi.fnsweb-p/zmr/checked/Meldeauskunft Address verification service] (''pub'')

litigation.wiki_content:
Austria's litigation records are accessible through various databases, with distinctions between civil, administrative, and criminal cases.

===Civil Litigation===

* [https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/ RIS - Austrian Legal Information System] - contains selected judgments from Austria's civil courts. Search by subject name, although individual parties to cases may be anonymized in some instances. This resource includes access to decisions from the Supreme Court (Oberster Gerichtshof) and other civil courts. (''pub'')

* [https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Jus/ Austrian Federal Legal Information System] for searching court decisions (''pub'')

* [http://www.ogh.gv.at/entscheidungen/ Austrian Supreme Court decisions] (''pub'')

===Administrative Litigation===

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
* [https://kbopub.economie.fgov.be/kbopub/zoeknummerform.html?lang=en Crossroads Bank for Enterprises -] Official business registry. The Federal Public Service (Ministry) of Economy maintains this corporate database.  It accepts searches by company name and number, and offers additional filters for activity, authorisation (for regulated activities) and address:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.  (''pub'')
* Belgian entities may adopt either French or Dutch [https://www.belgium.be/en/economy/business/creation/company_formats category names] (i.e., SRL/BV for private companies and SA/BV for public companies); the difference in name does not indicate a difference in entity type.  While the name can be deduced from the subject's region of registration, it’s best to check in official gazette records rather than on the CBE, which will give a translation into the selected local language.
* A search by name will deliver a list of names containing a given word, alongside similar spellings.  Note that duplicate results with the same corporate ID may appear, but clicking on either the corporate ID or “establishment unit” number will bring you to the same company profile page.  The CBE [https://economie.fgov.be/en/themes/enterprises/crossroads-bank-enterprises/registration-crossroads-bank defines] an “establishment unit” as “any place that is geographically identifiable by an address, where at least one activity of the entity is carried out”.
* The company profile page gives basic background details - name, status, corporate and establishment unit ID number, address, activities (including regulated activities).  Directors are identified under the “functions” tab towards the bottom of the page, which also gives their date of appointment.  Information on former directors is only available through National Gazette announcements, which also may provide additional identity information.  Reverse directorship searches are not possible.
* [https://e-justice.europa.eu/topics/registers-business-insolvency-land/business-registers-eu-countries/be_en European Commission overview of the] Belgian business registry (''pub'') – explains what data the Crossroads Bank holds and how to search:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
* [https://www.ejustice.just.fgov.be/cgi_tsv/rech.pl Justice Ministry's database for company-related] documents (''pub'') – search by enterprise number, name, postal code or subject:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
* [https://shop.trends-business-information.be/webshop/?lng=en#/ Trends Business Information - Third-party] database with legal files, credit reports and annual accounts (''paid'').
* [https://finances.belgium.be/fr/E-services/ubo-register UBO Register by Belgian Ministry] of Finance (requires Belgian e-government ID) (''pub'', ''reg'') – page describing the Register of Beneficial Owners (access to the register is currently suspended:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}).
* [https://www.fsma.be/en/shareholding Financial Services and Markets Authority] – Shareholder information for listed companies (''pub''):contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.
* Added: [https://consult.cbso.nbb.be/ National Bank of Belgium – Central Balance Sheet Office] – search portal for annual accounts filed by companies:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5} (''pub'').
* Added: [https://bpp.economie.fgov.be/ Benelux Patent Platform] – portal to consult the Belgian patent register (eRegister) and other Benelux IP searches:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6} (''pub'').

===Official Gazette===

* [https://www.ejustice.just.fgov.be/cgi/rech_res.pl Belgian Official Gazette] – should contain announcements of all appointments/resignations of directors since 1 June 1997.  Use this page for searching with filters (document type, source, publication date, language):contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.
* The publications in the National Gazette are categorised by the information declared, such as changes to company statutes, appointment of directors, and changes in ownership.  These are frequently in Dutch, but sometimes French (use the Google Translate app camera function to translate).

===Ownership===

* [https://finance.belgium.be/en/E-services/register-beneficial-owners UBO registry] maintained by the Federal Public Service of Finance is accessible via a Belgian e-government ID and certain EU e-gov IDs (including AT, CZ, NL).  '''However, since 2022 (still accurate as of March 2025), access to the registry has been suspended:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.'''
* Ownership information is only available through official records by accessing and reading national gazette announcements, which will be categorised as such.  If none are available, check the initial registration announcement.  Where a company’s initial shareholder(s) is an individual, the registration announcement will frequently give additional identification information on them, such as date of birth, address and marital status.
* The national gazette announcements of private companies (BVs and SAs) may identify shareholders only partially, or not at all.

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
* '''Commercial register and register of non‑profit legal entities (Registry Agency)''' – The portal at the Registry Agency acts as Bulgaria’s official business register. It combines the commercial register and the register of non‑profit legal entities and allows the public to search for current and historical information on companies and NGOs. Under the “References” section visitors can perform a “Reference by natural person or legal entity” search, view the state of play of a company, check lists of registered names, review rights over a name, and see registrations, erasures and announcements [https://portal.registryagency.bg/en/home-cr portal.registryagency.bg]. Basic information is freely accessible, while viewing filings or downloading documents requires registration and payment. Searches can be made using the unique company identifier (EIK/BULSTAT) or by company/individual name (in Bulgarian). Announcements about filings and court decisions are also published on the portal.

* '''Unified Trade Register of the Bulgarian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (BCCI)''' – The BCCI has maintained a voluntary unified trade register for more than 50 years. The register contains reliable information on the current status of Bulgarian companies, associations and representation offices of foreign entities [https://www.bcci.bg/tradereg-system-en.html BCCI unified trade register]. Users can search by company name or registration number (Bulstat/EIK) to retrieve registration details, status and proof of membership. Access to detailed reports and document downloads requires registration with the Chamber.

* '''Trade register “reference by person/organisation” page''' – The Registry Agency offers an English‑language search page titled “Reference by natural person or legal entity” (VerificationPersonOrg). It allows searches by personal or company identification number, name, or a combination of both. Basic results show whether a person or entity is registered and list associated companies; deeper information is available with login.

* '''OpenCorporates Bulgaria''' – OpenCorporates provides a reverse directorship search for Bulgarian companies. Searches must be carried out using Cyrillic characters; Latin letters return incomplete results. The database can reveal companies linked to a director or shareholder and provides company identifiers.

* '''Commercial register announcements''' – The Registry Agency’s announcements section publishes acts and documents filed with the commercial register, such as incorporation and dissolution notices, changes to company particulars and court orders. Searches can be filtered by date or company.

litigation.wiki_content:
* '''Unified portal for electronic justice (ЕПЕП)''' – Bulgaria’s electronic justice portal is an online database of court cases from all district, regional, administrative, military, appellate and supreme courts. The portal allows the public to view basic information about all cases with free access [https://ecase.justice.bg ecase.justice.bg]. Parties to a case can access the full electronic file and documents after registering with an electronic signature. The portal forms part of Bulgaria’s broader project to digitise civil procedure.

* '''Dela.bg''' – Independent search engine containing more than 2.3 million anonymised court rulings. The site states that it hosts the content of 2,338,130 published and anonymised judicial acts and provides a user‑friendly search interface [https://dela.bg dela.bg]. Searches can be filtered by court, case type and keywords.

* '''Supreme Court of Cassation (VKS) decisions search''' – The Supreme Court’s website provides a search interface for court judgments. Users can filter by year, month, type of act (decision, ruling, order) and by court division (civil, criminal or commercial) [https://www.vks.bg/search.html vks.bg]. 

* '''Constitutional Court “E‑spravki”''' – The Constitutional Court’s website offers electronic references (“E‑spravki”) for acts and cases. A menu links to “E‑spravki Acts” and “E‑spravki Cases” where users can look up decisions and pending cases [https://constcourt.bg/en/cases constcourt.bg]. Navigation is available in Bulgarian and English; the search interface itself is only in Bulgarian.

* '''Ministry of Justice – Legal acts search''' – The Ministry of Justice portal provides a search engine for published court acts across all courts. Users can filter by court (district, appellate, administrative, military and supreme courts) and case type; the drop‑down lists display courts and case categories [https://legalacts.justice.bg legalacts.justice.bg]. The interface is in Bulgarian and does not require registration.

[https://www.gov.br/pt-br/servicos/consultar-cadastro-nacional-de-pessoas-juridicas CNPJ National Register of Legal Entities] – National registry maintained by the Federal Revenue Service. It allows free look‑up of a company’s CNPJ number (14‑digit unique identifier), name, address and stated activities; the search can also display the Quadro de Sócios e Administradores (shareholders and administrators) once a CNPJ is provided
en.wikipedia.org
. Search requires a CNPJ number; results include status and registration date.

[https://www.jucea.am.gov.br/links-e-servicos/ Amazonas State Board of Trade] – Official board of trade for Amazonas. Provides corporate registration information and certificates for companies registered in the state; an account with a Brazilian CPF is needed for full access. There is no open public search.

[https://www.jucesponline.sp.gov.br/Busca/Busca.aspx Junta Comercial de São Paulo (JUCESP)] – Official commercial registry for São Paulo. Supports searches by company name, type, address, date or NIRE (state registration) number; digital documents and certificates are available once registered. Services are in Portuguese and some require login.

[https://www.jucerja.rj.gov.br/Servicos/BuscaEmpresasArtigo60 Commercial Registry of Rio de Janeiro (JUCERJA)] – Enables public searches under “Artigo 60” to verify whether a company is inactive and to request certificates; full company file access requires registration.

[https://www.jucergs.rs.gov.br/ Junta Comercial do Rio Grande do Sul] – Commercial registry for Rio Grande do Sul state (also branded JUCISRS). Provides company registration data and digital certificates; registration with a Brazilian ID is required. There is no public name search.

[https://www.jucemg.mg.gov.br/ibr/inicio Commercial Board of Minas Gerais (JUCEMG)] – Registration portal for companies in Minas Gerais. Offers digital services and certified copies; most services require user login and there is no open search.

[https://www.juntacomercial.pr.gov.br/ Junta Comercial do Paraná] – Official board of trade for Paraná. Provides online services including business registration and certificate requests. Access generally requires login and there is no public name search.

[https://www.jucec.ce.gov.br/ Commercial Board of Ceará] – Portal of Ceará’s commercial registry (JUCEC). Offers digital filing and certificate services; access typically requires login.

[https://www.jucema.ma.gov.br/ Commercial Board of Maranhão] – Junta Comercial do Maranhão. Provides digital services and company certificates; registration is required and there is no public search.

[https://jucap.ap.gov.br/ Commercial Registry of Amapá] – Official portal for Amapá’s commercial registry (JUCAP). Offers digital services and company certificates; registration is required and there is no public search.

[https://www.juceb.ba.gov.br/servicos/ Commercial Registry of Bahia] – Junta Comercial do Estado da Bahia. Offers online filings, document retrieval and certificate requests. Some services require registration; there is no open public search.

[https://www.jucees.es.gov.br/consultaempresasn/ Commercial Registry of Espírito Santo] – Juntas Comercial do Estado do Espírito Santo (JUCEES). Provides a “consulta empresas” search tool where users can look up companies by CNPJ or NIRE; login may be required for detailed information.

[https://portalservicos.jucemat.mt.gov.br/Portal/ Commercial Registry of Mato Grosso (JUCEMAT)] – Online portal for the commercial registry of Mato Grosso. Digital services and certificate requests require login with a Brazilian personal ID; there is no open search.

[https://www.jucems.ms.gov.br/ Commercial Registry of Mato Grosso do Sul (JUCEMS)] – Official registry portal for Mato Grosso do Sul. Offers online filings and certificate retrieval; access to the consultation service requires a gov.br account. There is no public name search.

[https://iged.jucepe.pe.gov.br:8081/ Commercial Registry of Pernambuco] – Junta Comercial do Estado de Pernambuco (JUCEPE). Provides digital services; registration is needed for company data.

[https://www.ceciex.com.br/ Conselho Brasileiro das Empresas Comerciais Importadoras e Exportadoras] – Business association offering company profiles, financial data, legal status and shareholder information for import–export companies. It is a paid service requiring registration.

[https://esic.cgu.gov.br/ Junta Comercial do Distrito Federal] – Government portal with contact and FOIA request information for the commercial registry of the Federal District. There is no direct company search.

[https://www.cge.go.gov.br/ Junta Comercial do Estado de Goiás] – State ombudsman portal, which serves as a contact point for Goiás’s commercial registry. No company search is available; document requests must be filed via the site.

[https://jucetins.to.gov.br/ Commercial Board of Tocantins (JUCETINS)] – Provides information on the commercial registry of Tocantins. Most online services require login; there is no public search.

[https://www.juceal.al.gov.br/ Commercial Registry of Alagoas] – Junta Comercial do Estado de Alagoas. Offers digital services and company certificates; users must log in with a Brazilian CPF (personal ID).

[https://www.facilita.al.gov.br/ Facilita Alagoas] – Portal integrating government services in Alagoas, including the commercial registry. Requires CPF and personal details to request company services.

[https://sintegra.sefaz.al.gov.br/#/ Alagoas – SINTEGRA] – Public consultation to the state tax registry (Sintegra). Allows search by CNPJ to check registration status and tax compliance.

[https://www.jucepb.pb.gov.br/ Junta Comercial do Estado da Paraíba] – Official portal for Paraíba’s commercial registry (JUCEP). Provides company certificates; access may require login. The previous direct CNPJ query link has been replaced by this portal.

[https://b3.com.br/en_us/products-and-services/trading/equities/listed-companies.htm Brasil Bolsa Balcão (B3)] – Brazil’s stock exchange. Its listed‑companies page provides classification, company website, major shareholders, financial statements, corporate actions and trading summaries for publicly traded companies.

[https://www.ccfacil.com.br/ CCFácil] – Commercial database providing company profiles, financial information, debt records, lawsuits, shareholders and corporate structure. A paid subscription and registration are required.

===Litigation===

[https://portal.stf.jus.br/portal-principal/principal.asp Federal Supreme Court of Brazil (STF)] – Official portal of the Supreme Federal Court. Provides access to court decisions, orders and docket information; the jurisprudence search tool requires JavaScript and may require user login.

===Regulatory===

[https://portal.tcu.gov.br/ Tribunal de Contas da União (TCU)] – Brazil’s Federal Court of Accounts, responsible for auditing public spending. The portal provides access to decisions, reports and an online consultation system (Portuguese only).

[https://www.gov.br/cvm/ Securities and Exchange Commission of Brazil (CVM)] – Regulator of Brazilian capital markets. The CVM portal publishes investor alerts, company filings, sanctions, and a search for administrative proceedings (Portuguese; some resources require login).

===Asset Registries===

[https://globenetwork.unodc.org/globenetwork/en/directory-of-open-source-registries/brazil.html Real estate and property registries] – According to the United Nations GlobE directory, preliminary property searches are available for the states of Espírito Santo, Mato Grosso do Sul, Paraná, Santa Catarina, São Paulo, Rio Grande do Sul, Rondônia, Rio de Janeiro, and the Federal District
globenetwork.unodc.org
. These searches identify the registration number and registry office; detailed ownership information requires a qualified inquiry and payment
globenetwork.unodc.org
.

[https://globenetwork.unodc.org/globenetwork/en/directory-of-open-source-registries/brazil.html Vehicle registries] – The same UN GlobE directory notes that vehicle information can be checked via state transport departments (e.g., Rio de Janeiro and the Federal District); searches are by licence plate and provide vehicle details but not owner names. Basic searches are free; detailed certificates may require payment
globenetwork.unodc.org
.

[https://www.inpi.gov.br/portal/ National Institute of Industrial Property (INPI)] – Federal agency responsible for patents, trademarks and industrial designs. The portal provides public searches of patent and trademark filings; registration is required for advanced queries.

[https://www.openlandcontracts.org/ Open Land Contracts] – Repository of publicly available oil, gas and mining contracts. Contains a small number of Brazilian land contracts and concession agreements.

[https://revista.egn.mar.mil.br/ Tribunal Marítimo] – Maritime court that publishes decisions, vessel registration data and casualty reports (in Portuguese). The site provides searchable PDFs of rulings.

===Further Public Records===

[https://id.occrp.org/databases/#brazil OCCRP ID Database – Brazil] – Index of leaked databases and documents compiled by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP). Searches may reveal persons and companies mentioned in investigations; free registration is required.

[https://www.gov.br/transparencia/ Portal da Transparência] – Brazil’s official open‑data portal on federal spending. Allows searches by beneficiary name, company name or CNPJ to view contracts, grants and other public spending data.

[https://www.escavador.com/ Escavador] – Commercial search engine that aggregates public information on Brazilian individuals and companies, including court cases, corporate filings and government contracts. Offers both free and paid plans.

[https://www.sefaz.pb.gov.br/servirtual/2016-01-05-19-01-00 Official Gazette of Paraíba] – Digital version of Paraíba’s state gazette. Provides legal notices and corporate filings; searchable by date or keyword.

[https://sic.pb.gov.br/pedidos-e-respostas FOIA requests database of Paraíba] – Publicly accessible database of freedom‑of‑information requests and answers for Paraíba.

[https://dados.gov.br/ Portal Brasileiro de Dados Abertos] – National open data portal aggregating datasets from federal, state and municipal governments. Data can be browsed by theme, organization or keyword; provides datasets on companies, public spending and public officials.

===Political===

No dedicated national political donor or lobbyist databases were identified.

===Media===

No dedicated media registry was identified.

===Social Media===

No dedicated social media directory was identified.

===Breaches===

No dedicated breach database was identified.

litigation.wiki_content:
* [http://commonlii.org/bz/ Common Legal Information Institute -] Keyword search for court cases. This site publishes limited court records from the Supreme Court dating from 1978-present, and domain name decisions from 2003 and 2004. (''pub'')

* [http://www.belizejudiciary.org/judgements2/ Supreme Court judgements (civil and] criminal) available by year. Supreme Court judgements are available by year but you cannot search them by keyword. (''pub'')

* [http://www.belizelaw.org/web/supreme_court/judgments.html Belize Law - Supreme Court] and Court of Appeal Judgments (1972-2014). This site covers information about laws, the judiciary, and judgments from the Supreme Court and Court of Appeal (Civil and Criminal) and Privy Council Judgments. (''pub'')

* [http://www.caribbeancourtofjustice.org/judgments-proceedings/original-jurisdiction-judgments Caribbean Court of Justice -] Original Jurisdiction judgments (''pub'')

* [http://www.caribbeancourtofjustice.org/judgments-proceedings/appellate-jurisdiction-judgments Caribbean Court of Justice -] Appeals (''pub'')

* [http://www.caribbeancourtofjustice.org/judgments-proceedings/pending-cases Caribbean Court of Justice -] Pending Cases (''pub'')

The Caribbean Court of Justice is the judicial institution of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM) and is the final court of appeal for Barbados, Belize, Dominica, and Guyana. Established in 2001, it is based in Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago. 
The Caribbean Court of Justice has two jurisdictions: an original jurisdiction and an appellate jurisdiction:
- In its original jurisdiction, the CCJ interprets and applies the Revised Treaty of Chaguaramas (which established CARICOM), and is an international court with compulsory and exclusive jurisdiction in respect of the interpretation of the treaty.
- In its appellate jurisdiction, the CCJ hears appeals as the court of last resort in both civil and criminal matters from those member states which have ceased to allow appeals to the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council (JCPC).

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
===National Corporate Records===

[https://www.ic.gc.ca/eic/site/cd-dgc.nsf/eng/home Corporations Canada] (''pub'')

Corporations Canada offers a registry for entities incorporated at the federal level. Researchers can search by company name or registration number to access information such as:
- Company name
- Registered office address
- Names and addresses of directors
- Incorporation date
- Corporate status

Note: The data here might be periodically scraped by third-party aggregators like OpenCorporates, but it's essential to verify information against the official source for accuracy.

[https://beta.canadasbusinessregistries.ca/search Canada's Business Registries] (''pub'')

This service allows you to search across multiple provincial registries simultaneously, including Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, Ontario, and Quebec. Researchers can search by company name, business number, or registry ID.

Data Available:
- Entity type
- Directors and officers (current and former)
- Incorporation date
- Registered address

===Provincial Corporate Records===

[https://www.alberta.ca/business-search.aspx Alberta Business Search] (''pub'')

Alberta's corporate registration information can be accessed here. This site is useful for identifying a company's registered name and verifying its corporate status.

Data Available:
- Company name
- Registration details
- Names of directors (including home addresses)
- Corporate status

[https://www.bconline.gov.bc.ca/main.html British Columbia Registry Services] (''pub'', ''paid'', ''reg'')

BC Online provides access to corporate registration, civil, criminal, and property records. The service requires a login and offers comprehensive details.

[https://orgbook.gov.bc.ca/ OrgBook BC] (''pub'')

Use this database to verify if an organization is legally registered to do business in British Columbia as a corporation. You can also find "Doing Business As" names registered by corporations.

[https://www.gov.mb.ca/chc/archives/ Manitoba Business Information Service] (''pub'')

Call the service to access full corporate registration information for companies in Manitoba. The service provides shareholding structure and a list of directors and officers, including their home addresses.

[https://www.pxw1.snb.ca/snb7001/e/2000/2400e_1.asp Corporate Affairs Registry Database - New Brunswick] (''pub'')

This database allows you to search by keyword for corporate records in New Brunswick. Records include a list of directors and their home addresses.

[https://cado.eservices.gov.nl.ca/CADOInternet/Registry/Welcome.aspx Newfoundland Registry of Companies] (''pub'')

Search the CADO system for corporate records in Newfoundland. This service includes a list of directors and officers, along with their home addresses.

[https://www.iti.gov.nt.ca/en/services/business-services-directory NWT Corporate Registries Online System] (''pub'')

Run a basic name search as a guest to obtain more detailed information. The Northwest Territories registry provides additional information on nationally registered corporations.

[https://novascotia.ca/sns/access/business/registry-joint-stock-companies.asp Registry of Joint Stock Companies - Nova Scotia] (''pub'')

Search this database for business or society information on file with the Nova Scotia Registry of Joint Stock Companies. Records include company officers, activity history, and other related registrations.

[https://gov.nu.ca/edt/information/nunavut-corporate-registry Nunavut Corporate Registry] (''pub'')

Search by business name to access records that provide a "point of contact," usually an officer or director.

[https://www.ontario.ca/page/serviceontario ServiceOntario] (''pub'')

This service is used to identify companies registered in Ontario. Records include directors, officers, and an address, which may be residential.

[https://cyberbahn.ca/en/ Cyberbahn] (''pub'', ''paid'')

Use this service to search for Ontario corporate registrations if you can't otherwise identify directors and their home addresses. This service may involve a fee.

[https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/feature/pei-business-corporate-registry-original#/ Prince Edward Island Government Corporate Registry] (''pub'')

Search this database for corporate records in Prince Edward Island. Records include a list of directors and officers.

[https://www.registreentreprises.gouv.qc.ca/RQAnonymeGR/GR/GR03/GR03A2_19A_PIU_RechEnt_PC/PageRechSimple.aspx?T1.CodeService=S00436&Clng=F&WT.co_f=24a032c4ade39a97aad1557277350006 Revenu Quebec Business Name Search] (''pub'')

This service provides information on directors and executives in Quebec. It is advisable to cross-check the data against the official source for accuracy.

[https://www.ccmm.ca/en Chamber of Commerce of Metropolitan Montreal Member Directory] (''pub'')

Search this directory for companies that have partnered with the Chamber of Commerce of Metropolitan Montreal.

[https://nuans.com/en/home NUANS] (''pub'')

Run a search on this service to identify where a company is registered. It is not considered an authority for corporate registration sections in reports.

* '''Trade and Furniture Credit Register (RCCM) – Ministry of Justice and Human Rights''' – [https://rccm.cd/rccm/ Business registry search].  The Trade and Furniture Credit Register (Registre du Commerce et du Crédit Mobilier) is the official business registry for the DRC.  Users can search for economic players registered with the RCCM and obtain basic information such as corporate name, trade name, RCCM number, legal form, entry date and province:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.  The search interface allows queries by company name and displays basic registration data; detailed filings are not available online.

* '''Guichet Unique de Création d’Entreprise (GUCE)''' – [https://guichetunique.cd/ Guichet Unique portal].  GUCE is intended to be a one‑stop shop for company registration.  The site provides information on registration procedures and forms but the portal is not fully functional; access to company data is limited and may require in‑person queries.

* '''Africa Business Pages Directory''' – [http://directory.africa-business.com Africa Business Pages].  An Africa‑wide commercial directory published from the UAE.  It offers company listings by sector and country but does not replace official registers.  Search results include company names and brief descriptions.

* '''Regulatory Authority for Subcontracting in the Private Sector (ARSP)''' – [https://test.arsp.cd/en/list-of-registered-companies/ ARSP registered companies] (site may be intermittent).  As of May 2023 the ARSP site was intermittently down.  Limited registration data for certain mining companies is available via this official register, but broader searches may not return results.

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
===Moneyhouse===

Moneyhouse.ch is a private third-party corporate record aggregator, and it's usually the most convenient place to start looking at corporate records. We have an account, and when logged in some extra information should be visible, so it's best to do that. 

This website has a simple search function where you can enter the name of a company or an individual, and it'll search all Swiss cantons plus Liechtenstein. If you enter an individual's name, it'll show you directorships but not ownership. 

The page for a company shows a decent amount of information, though not arranged in the most user-friendly way. 

* In the first section ("Übersicht" in German), you can see its share capital, number of employees, address, sector of business, directors' names, incorporation date and purpose (often quite a detailed and specific description), then there's the most recent corporate filing that names them (from the Swiss Official Gazette of Commerce, "SHAB").
* The second section ("Auskünfte") allows you to buy various types of financial report.
* The third section ("Management") shows you current and past directors, and their dates.
* The fourth section ("Netzwerk") visually displays directorships and doesn't seem very useful.
* The fifth section ("Timeline") shows major events on a timeline.
* The sixth section ("Kennzahlen") shows some basic information already included in the first section.
* The seventh section ("Besitzverhältnisse") should in theory list the company's shareholders and shareholdings/subsidiaries, but in practice it's very often empty/incomplete.
* The eighth section ("Meldungen") lists SHAB filings.
* The ninth section ("Marken") lists brands registered with the company.

The page for an individual shows more limited information: 
* The first section ("Übersicht") only really shows their citizenship (or for Swiss citizens, canton of origin) and place of residence (town if in Switzerland, town and country if abroad) and then provides the most recent corporate filing that mentions them.
* The second tab ("Auskünfte") allows you to download a PDF containing the information from the first, third and fifth tabs.
* The third tab ("Mandate") shows a list of past and present directorships and their dates.
* The fourth tab ("Netzwerk") visualizes their connections and doesn't seem particularly useful.
* The fifth tab ("Beteiligungen") should in theory show companies in which they own shares, but in practice it's usually empty.
* The sixth tab ("Meldungen") provides a list of corporate filings that mention them.

As Moneyhouse is a third-party website, we don't usually cite it directly in our reports. To cite, we can either provide a link to an official website (see below) or just write something like "Swiss corporate records".

* [http://www.moneyhouse.ch/ Online company database with director] names, shareholders, gazette notifications and registered company activity (''pub'', ''paid'')

===Swiss Official Gazette of Commerce (SHAB)===

The Swiss Official Gazette of Commerce, generally known by its German acronym SHAB, has an official website at shab.ch. Its local names are Schweizerisches Handelsamtsblatt (German), Feuille officielle suisse du commerce (French) and Foglio ufficiale svizzero di commercio (Italian).

The SHAB contains entries for certain types of changes to corporate records, such as the establishment or dissolution of a company, the addition or removal of directors, and changes of company names. There are two search fields on the website's homepage, one for all entries since 2 September 2018 and one for all entries before that, back until 1999. 

It's worth searching this website if the information on Moneyhouse seems questionable or incomplete, which may especially be the case when a company has changed name or address. 

* [https://www.shab.ch/shabforms/COMMON/application/applicationGrid.jsp?newLanguage=EN Swiss Official Gazette of Commerce] - Information about company changes and gazette notifications (''pub'')

===Official cantonal corporate registries===

Each Swiss canton has its own corporate registry, and although Moneyhouse generally does a good job of aggregating data from all of them, it's often a good idea to check the relevant official registry too, to be certain of up-to-date information. In some cases, the official registry may contain information that Moneyhouse lacks. As these registries are official, if they let you link directly to companies' pages, you can use these links as citations in your reports.

Here are the cantonal registries:
* Aargau https://ag.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Appenzell Inner-Rhodes https://ai.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Appenzell Outer-Rhodes https://ar.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Basel City https://bs.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Basel-Landschaft https://bl.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml 
* Bern https://be.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Fribourg https://adm.appls.fr.ch/hrcmatic/
* Geneva https://app2.ge.ch/ecohrcinternet/ 
* Glarus https://gl.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Grisons https://gr.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Jura https://ju.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Lucerne https://lu.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Neuchâtel https://www.ne.ch/autorites/DESC/NECO/rcne/Pages/Recherche-d'entreprises.aspx
* Nidwalden https://nw.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml
* Obwalden https://ow.chregister.ch/cr-portal/suche/suche.xhtml

===Federal===

You can search for records on the following court websites:

* Federal Court (Bundesgericht): https://www.bger.ch/ext/eurospider/live/fr/php/clir/http/index.php (Switzerland's supreme court; cases since 1954)
* Federal Administrative Court (Bundesverwaltungsgericht): https://bvger.weblaw.ch/dashboard (cases since 2007)
* Federal Criminal Court (Bundesstrafgericht): https://bstger.weblaw.ch/dashboard (cases since 2004; largely anonymised)
* Federal Patent Court (Bundespatentgericht): https://www.bundespatentgericht.ch/rechtsprechung/einfache-suche

* [http://www.bger.ch/ Bundesgericht - The Supreme Court] of Switzerland (''pub'')

* [https://bstger.weblaw.ch/index.php?= Bundesstrafgericht - The Federal Criminal] Court database of cases (''pub'')

* [https://www.bger.ch/it/index.htm Supreme Court records - Requires] journalist accreditation for detailed information (''pub'', ''reg'')

* [http://bstger.weblaw.ch/index.php?method=search The Swiss Tribunal penal federal] - Searchable database of decisions (''pub'')

* [https://www.bstger.ch/en/il-tribunale/il-tribunale-penale-federale-in-breve.html Federal Supreme Court - Landmark] rulings since 1954 (''pub'')

* [http://relevancy.bger.ch/ Federal Supreme Court - Further] rulings since 2000 (''pub'')

* [https://www.bundespatentgericht.ch Federal Patent Court - Database] of patent cases (''pub'')

* [https://jurispub.admin.ch/publiws/ Federal Administrative Court decisions and] judgments (''pub'')

* [https://www.bvger.ch Federal Administrative Court website]  (''pub'')

* [https://www.bvger.ch/bvger/en/home/judgments/entscheiddatenbank-bvger.html Federal Administrative Court judgment database]  (''pub'')

===Cantonal===

You can search for records on the following court websites (this list is currently non-exhaustive):

* Bern: https://www.zsg-entscheide.apps.be.ch/tribunapublikation/ (civil and criminal)
* Valais: https://jurisprudence.vs.ch/ (database of selected decisions from the Cantonal Court of Valais; cases since 2009; completely anonymised)
* Zug: https://verwaltungsgericht.zg.ch/ (Administrative Court)
* Zug: https://obergericht.zg.ch/ (High Court)
* Zurich: https://www.gerichte-zh.ch/entscheide/entscheide-suchen.html (unified database for decisions from the High Court of the Canton of Zurich, the Court of Cassation of the Canton of Zurich, the Commercial Court of the Canton of Zurich, and the canton's 12 district courts)

Limited litigation available on Juricaf. Database of case law in French providing the decisions of supreme courts across the French speaking world. Funded by the French Ministry of Justice and the International Organisation of La Francophonie. Is very limited in scope.

It is possible to undertake high level litigation checks of companies and individuals on the Centre National De Documentation Juridique (www.cndj.ci) and on the following database: [www.cotedivoire.regulations.org]

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
[https://www.bolsadesantiago.com/ Santiago Stock Exchange]

The Santiago Stock Exchange website has a list of issuers and brokers under the "markets" drop-down menu. You can search the issuers list using a search bar and the bigger companies will have summaries with the president, address and general manager.

[https://conservador.cl/portal/indice_comercio Índice del Registro de Comercio]	

This registry (Índice del Registro de Comercio) allows you to search by company name and should show you at least the company's founding document, which should list the company's activities and name its shareholders. May only contain companies registered in Santiago (if anyone confirms that it contains companies outside of Santiago, please delete this sentence).

[https://palena.sii.cl/cvc_cgi/dte/ee_empresas_dte	Tax Authority Database]

Search a tax authority database for organisations authorised to issue electronic documents (not all will be present). Search by taxpayer ID (RUT), which can be found through https://www.boletaofactura.com/buscar or other 3rd parties.

[https://registros19862.cl/	Government Database]

Search government database for companies registered as working with the state. Not all will be present.

[https://www.conservador.cl Chilean commercial register]

Search for companies registered in Santiago and find registration details including address etc. The website also supports searching by name of individuals to retrieve information about companies they're associated with. More results may be found using click through. 

[https://www.conservador.cl Chilean commercial register]

Search by name of individuals to retrieve information about companies they're associated with. Click through to view registry bulletins. 

[http://alvm.prefecturanaval.gob.ar Acuerdo Viña del Mar]

The Latin American Agreement on Port State Control of vessels is called Viña del Mar. Member states are Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Honduras, Mexico, Panama, Peru, Uruguay and Venezuela. Search by ship name, flag, IMO or port of inspection to find out whether the ship in question passed its inspection, and why it didn't. This information is available on click through. 
 
[http://www.iadb.org/en/projects Inter-American Development Bank - Approved Projects]

Database of projects of the Inter-American Development Bank. Supports search by keyword, project/operation number, country and includes more filter options (status, topic, sector, subsector etc). Retrieves information about country, project name, project number, amount of financing, and approval date. More information can be obtained by clicking on the project name (extra project documents). 
 
[https://www.camaraisrael.org.il Israel-Latin American Chamber of Commerce Cámara de Comercio Israel - América Latina]

Members index for the Israel-Latin American Chamber of Commerce. Search by member name.

[http://www.chileproveedores.cl Ministry of Finance - Registered supplier registry Registro Oficial de ChileCompra]

The public procurement department of the Chilean Ministry of Finance offers a directory of companies that have registered with the government in order to be able to compete for state tenders. 

[https://www.diariooficial.interior.gob.cl/ Official Journal of the Republic of Chile - Verification Of Documents Diario Oficial de la República de Chile]

The Official Journal of the Republic of Chile is Chile's government gazette – a means of publication of laws, decrees, and other legal regulations issued by state bodies. 

[http://www.amarillas.cl Yellow Pages Amarillas]

Official yellow pages website for Chile.

Companies and Individuals are assigned a RUT or RUN tax identification number. Companies get a RUT while for a person the RUT and RUN are the same number.

RUT/RUN has 7 or 8 digits followed by a 1-digit check number: (xx.xxx.xxx-z, z is {0-9, K})

This number can be found for individuals on the following website. Results will also include the individual's gender and an address for the subject, though this address information should not be considered current or authoritative. Do not cite this source directly.

[https://www.nombrerutyfirma.com/ Nombre, Rut Y Firma]

If the link above is down (as it occasionally goes down from time to time), then google "Chile" and "RUT" to find an alternative search.
For companies, the RUT can be found on the company registration via the City of Santiago Real Estate Registrar search, detailed in the Entity Identification section.

[https://www.diariooficial.interior.gob.cl/ Sayari]	

Run the Sayari search for all subjects, the login information for which is saved in Zoho. Currently, Sayari only contains Chilean Official Gazette records for Chile.
In the search bar on the right-hand side of the page, under Sources, type the name of the country and select Select Only These. This will populate all of Sayari' sources available for that specific country. Next, in the upper left corner, enter the name of the subject in the search bar and hit enter. This will provide all results available for the subject in that country. If searching for a company's corporate records, it's recommended to use quotes (without the company suffix).

The Official Gazette of Chile can and should also be searched directly. Click 'Edicion Electronica' and 'Empresas y Cooperativas' to scan for recently registered companies. Older editions can be consulted by date (click 'Ediciones Anteriores'), but there's no search by subject name available. Also conduct a site search.

[https://zeus.sii.cl/cvc/stc/stc.html Chile's Internal Revenue Service]

Chile's Internal Revenue Service includes limited information about companies including their business activities and the date that the company started operating. This search will also confirm whether a company is classified as a small business. A RUT is required to conduct this search.

[https://www.nombrerutyfirma.com/ Rutificador and City of Santiago Real Estate Registrar]

Identify the RUT (tax identification number) for your individual and look in City of Santiago Real Estate Registrar records for other supporting information that can be used to distinguish your subject. This number can be found for individuals on the following website. Results will also include the individual's gender and an address for the subject, though this address information should not be considered current or authoritative. Do not cite this source directly.

[https://consulta.servel.cl/ Consulta Datos Electorales]

If you know where your Subject works, also check the company's corporate filings in the City of Santiago Real Estate Registrar described in the next previous section for identifying entities. This is often a good way to find an individual's RUT if otherwise proving difficult to find.
Electoral Service of Chile	"RUT is needed to run searches. This site may help you to identify the province of an individual's last known address.

[https://zeus.sii.cl/cvc/stc/stc.html Chile's Internal Revenue Service]

An individual's address may also be reported in corporate registration documents for their affiliated companies.
Chile's Internal Revenue Service	"OPTIONAL Chile's Internal Revenue Service includes limited information about individuals including their business activities and the date that they started. A RUT is required to conduct this search. Good for low profile individuals that you are unable to find much information on.

[http://www.prochile.gob.cl ProChile Export Directory]

An agency which belongs to the Directory of International Economic Relations under the Chilean Ministry of Exterior. This agency support and promotes the Chilean exporting companies.

litigation.wiki_content:
[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl	Poder Judicial de Chile]

Search for court records on the website of the Chile Judiciary. 

[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl Chile Judiciary - Labor Courts of Collection]

Search rulings of the Chilean Labour Courts of Collection by keyword. Full text available on click-through.

[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl Chile Judiciary - Labour Courts  Juzgados Laborales]

Search full judgments of the Chilean Labour Courts by keywords. Full text available on click-through.

[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl Chile Supreme Court Corte Suprema de Justicia de Chile]

Search rulings of the Supreme Court of Chile by keyword. Full text available on click-through. Limited availability of results after 2014. 

[http://reformaprocesal.poderjudicia First Instance Courts Penal Case Search]

Search criminal cases by party name, year and court name. Details about parties, type of crime, case history and case status are provided on click-through. 

[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl/fallos_civiles/jurisprudencia.php Search 1 - Corte Suprema Poder Judicial de Chile - Civil Case Search Juzgados Civiles]

The website allows to search by keyword for full judgments from first instance civil courts in Chile.

[http://basejurisprudencial.poderjudicial.cl/fallos_suprema/jurisprudencia.php Search 2 - Juzgados Civiles Poder Judicial de Chile - Criminal case search - AMS Corte Suprema de Justicia de Chile]

Search rulings of the Supreme Court of Chile by keyword. Full text available on click-through. Limited availability of results after 2014.

[https://oficinajudicialvirtual.pjud.cl/indexN.php Chile Judiciary Database - unified court search]

Before Doing Litigation Research for the First Time

Refer to the [https://portals.exiger.com/sites/JHKTyvxJ95CX6eAk7GrG/H6IKd/Latin%20America/Glossary/Spanish/Spanish%20Legal%20Term%20Glossary.xlsx Spanish Language Glossary] for any unknown legal terms that we have already documented. For any terms not in the glossary, conduct google research to identify the definition or reach out to another member of the LatAm team for help.

Before starting litigation searches, also refer to the Chile Litigation Guidance below.

Legal System Overview

The legal system of Chile is complex and comprises more than 450 individual courts. At the top of Chile's judicial structure is the Supreme Court which exercises superintendence of all administrative courts in Chile as well as other more specialized courts including Free Competition Defense Court, the Public Procurement Court, the Environmental Courts, the Industrial Property Court and the Local Police Courts.

Courts for the administration of justice are located throughout the country, divided among 17 jurisdictional territories of Chile, each of which is headed by its own respective court of appeals. These courts are located in the cities of Arica, Iquique, Antofagasta, Copiapó, La Serena, Valparaíso, Santiago, San Miguel, Rancagua, Talca, Chillán, Concepción, Temuco, Valdivia, Puerto Montt, Coyhaique and Punta Arenas.

In addition to the aforementioned courts, there are other courts including those of mixed jurisdictions, civil courts, guarantee courts, oral criminal trial courts, family courts, labor letter courts, and labor and pension collection courts which are located both in the cities that are the seat of the Court of Appeals, as well as in the provincial capitals and in the communes or groups of communes.

Chile Judiciary Database

The Chile Judiciary Database contains a search that can be used to search all of the courts included in the Chile Judiciary, broken up into the following categories:

- Supreme Court

- Appellate Courts

- Civil

- Labor 

- Penal

For this category: You have to search by specific tribunal and year. In order to narrow, please search based on the tribunal which has jurisdiction on the comuna associated with your subject's address history (use the one generated by the Rutificator if you have no address info) and the comuna of the HQ of the subject company (if applicable). Consult the following [https://www.leychile.cl/Consulta/m/norma_plana?idNorma=25563&org=cdr link] to find the appropriate tribunal which has jurisdiction over the applicable comuna.

Collection

Family

Separate searches should be conducted for each of the aforementioned categories. Searches should be conducted by RUN/RUT if we have that information. If not, then searches can be conducted by the subject's name.

Link for the main search of the Chile Judiciary Database: https://oficinajudicialvirtual.pjud.cl/indexN.php

A site search should also be conducted for all subjects on the main judiciary website: https://www.pjud.cl

[https://www.tribunalconstitucional.cl/expedientes Constitutional Court]

Conduct internal and site searches of the constitutional court of Chile for all subjects which, as the name suggests, deals with matters pertaining to Chile's constitution.

General Note about Litigation Searches in Chile

While they are functional, we can usually conduct fairly comprehensive litigation searches in Chile with relative ease as compared to other LatAm countries. However, the Chile litigation searches have a history of being unreliable and frequently go down. If you are unable to access the court searches with the Oficina Judicial link provided in the Chile Judiciary Database section, please try this link www.pjud.cl and navigate to the section marked "consulta unificada de causas." Search all courts available and follow the above directions.
If this does not work, then please get in touch with your PM and the LatAm regional lead as you will need to contact IT for permission to use SILO to conduct these searches.

Litigation Guidance

Please ask IT for access to Silo, this website is need to access the main Chilean litigation search.
Court records are usually accessible to the public. This means that the court documents are quite extensive and you will be able to get a lot of details and information from the court websites. We are working on getting the website to work on Exiger computers, however, this is a work in progress.
The Chilean judicial system is divided into three levels: Supreme Court, Courts of Appeals and courts of the first instance, which include trial courts, guarantee courts, and criminal oral trial courts.

At the top of the judiciary courts there is a Supreme Court (La Corté Suprema de Justicia de Chile). The Supreme Court has the administrative and regulatory control of all judges. Supreme court judges are refered to as Ministros.

There are 13 courts of appeals and many lower level courts divided into 16 regions and further divided into civil and criminal matters, children and labor.
There are also judges in taxation matters at the lower level, but they are not independent.

Constitutional Court ("Tribunal Constitucional")

This court is in charge of the constitutional review of the laws. This authority must declare a law or an act with the force of law inapplicable or unconstitutional. In the first case, the norm ceases to have effect but only in the specific case where is declared. In the second case, the norm ceases to have effect in general terms.
It is unlikely you will have many findings from this court.

Ministerio Publico (Public Prosecutor's Office)

Directs investigations into crimes, it does not take the place of a court, no one will file a case with the MP. The MP accompanies cases, runs investigations, and sometimes makes decisions that should be filed with the appropriate court. One may file a complaint to have the MP investigate t a possible crime but, if evidence is identified this person will go to a "Guarentee Court"

[http://www.fiscaliadechile.cl/Fiscalia/index.do Public Prosecutor's Office]

Independent public agency responsible for enforcing all criminal offenses. Conduct internal and site searches for all subjects. 

[https://www.fne.gob.cl/ National Economic Prosecutor's Office] and [https://www.fne.gob.cl/jurisprudencia-en-libre-competencia/ National Economic Prosecutor's Office - Competition Law Jurisprudence]

Conduct internal and site searches of the following two links which cover matters pertaining to economic issues. It is important to run internal searches on both links as the website's search tab will turn up PDFs that a google search is incapable of finding.

[https://www.boletinconcursal.cl/boletin/procedimientos Registry of Bankruptcies]

Search by RUT (if available) or name to identify information about bankruptcies or other debts.

litigation.wiki_content:
[http://www.coursupreme.cm/?q=en/jurisprudence Supreme Court of Cameroon verdicts] (in French)

[http://www.juricaf.org Juricaf (Cameroon)]

Database of case law in French providing the decisions of supreme courts across the French speaking world. Funded by the French Ministry of Justice and the International Organisation of La Francophonie. Is very limited in scope. Juricaf is a French case law database that collects Supreme Court judgements from French-speaking nations, including Cameroon. 
Be sure just to check the box for Cameroon and fill in the search field. You should also conduct a site search.

[https://juricaf.org/recherche_avancee French case law database for] Supreme Court judgements

[http://www.worldlii.org/catalog/2685.html WorldLII Cameroon]

Conduct search in the search bar at the top of the page.

Additional Information on the Cameroonian Court System

Cameroon has a "bijural" legal system wherein English Common Law is practiced in Anglophone regions of the Northwest and Southwest while French Civil Law is practiced in the eight francophone regions of Adamaoua, Centre, East, Far North, Littoral, North, West and South.

Courts of First Instance, Regional Courts, and Courts of Appeal

Courts of First Instance (tribunaux de première instance) try civil cases where claims do not exceed CFA 500,000, as well as criminal offenses, but not crimes. There are also regional courts (tribunaux de grande instance) that have territorial jurisdiction in their respective departments that, like the lower level Courts of First Instance, try civil cases where claims do not exceed CFA 500,000 cases, only they also also try crimes. Courts of Appeal hear cases from either Courts of First Instance or Regional Courts.

Supreme Court

The Supreme Court (Cour suprême) is the highest level of court in Cameroon and is independent of the executive and legislative branches of government, subject to oversight only from the Higher Judicial Council. There are three chambers of the Supreme Court: the judicial chamber, which rules on standard cases appealed from lower courts pertaining to civil, criminal, and social matters; the administrative chamber, which rules on state affairs (e.g. election disputes); and the audit chamber, which rules on cases pertaining to public accounts and semi-private entities. The Supreme Court is subordinate to the executive branch's Ministry of Justice.

Constitutional Council

The Constitutional Council (Conseil constitutionnel) interprets the Constitution and evaluates the constitutionality of laws and decrees. There are 11 members of the Constitutional Council that are appointed by the president for single, nine-year terms.

High Court of Justice

The High Court of Justice (Haute cour de justice) has the jurisdiction to try the president and senior ranking government officials for high treason or conspiracy against national security. There are 15 members of the High Court of Justice – nine judges and six substitute judges – that are appointed by the National Assembly.

Other Courts

The State Security Court hears cases pertaining to matters of internal and external state security. There are also military courts (tribunaux mlitaires).

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
* '''Chinese Stock Exchanges – list of listed companies (CNINFO)''' – The official disclosure platform for companies listed on the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges provides an English‑language “Company List” that shows foundation and listing dates, contact information, websites, senior management and the top five shareholders for each company. The company list can be browsed alphabetically or searched by ticker symbol or company name [http://www.cninfo.com.cn/new/snapshot/companyListEn cninfo.com.cn] (English). Access to detailed filings is free but may be slow outside China.

* '''National Enterprise Credit Information Publicity System (NECIPS)''' – The Ministry of Commerce’s central database of Chinese companies. Users can search by the company’s Unified Social Credit Code or legal name to obtain registration details, business scope, legal representative, filings and administrative penalties. The site is only accessible from mainland China and displays results in Chinese; login with a mainland mobile phone number may be required for some documents [http://gsxt.saic.gov.cn/ gsxt.saic.gov.cn].

* '''Beijing Corporate Registry (Beijing Administration for Market Regulation)''' – A regional portal for searching companies registered in Beijing. Search by company name, registration number or legal representative to obtain the company’s status and registration details. This site requires simplified Chinese input and may only be accessible within China [http://qyxy.baic.gov.cn qyxy.baic.gov.cn].

* '''China Company Free Search Engine (RegistrationChina)''' – An English‑language interface that draws data from the NECIPS and other official sources. Users can search by company name or Unified Social Credit Code to retrieve basic details such as registration number, legal representative, business scope and status. It is free to use and does not require a mainland IP, but it is not an official government service [https://www.registrationchina.com/china-company-search/ registrationchina.com].

* '''Hong Kong Companies Registry – ICRIS''' – The Integrated Companies Registry Information System provides an online search for Hong Kong‑registered companies. Users can conduct a free company name search to see whether a name exists and order detailed company documents for a fee. Registration is required to purchase reports, but not for the basic name search [https://www.icris.cr.gov.hk/csci/ icris.cr.gov.hk] (English).

* '''21315 company search''' – A private portal that aggregates information from the national credit publicity system. Users can search by company name in simplified Chinese to obtain registration details for businesses nationwide. Basic results are free; detailed reports require payment [http://21315.com/ 21315.com].

* '''Tianyancha company search''' – A widely used third‑party database of Chinese‑registered companies. Searches return registration details, key personnel, shareholding structure and litigation records. The site offers limited access for free users; full access requires a paid subscription [http://www.tianyancha.com/ tianyancha.com].

litigation.wiki_content:
* '''China Judgements Online (Wenshu) – Supreme People's Court''' – This official database publishes court judgments from the Supreme People’s Court and courts at all levels across China. Users can search by case number, keywords, document type or court. Access requires registration, and as of 2021 the site is generally only reachable from within China [http://wenshu.court.gov.cn wenshu.court.gov.cn].

* '''Beijing Courts – judgment documents''' – Portal providing access to judgments from the Beijing High Court, intermediate courts and local courts since 2007. Searches can be performed by case number, parties or keywords (Chinese only) [http://bjgy.chinacourt.org/paper.sh bjgy.chinacourt.org].

* '''Debtor Information Search – Supreme People's Court''' – A national database of enforced cases and debtors subject to execution. Users can search by name or ID number to identify individuals or entities with outstanding judgments [http://zhixing.court.gov.cn/search/ zhixing.court.gov.cn].

* '''Enforcement database (失信被执行人名单)''' – Maintained by the Supreme People’s Court, this site lists individuals and companies who have been declared dishonest debtors. Searches can be performed by name or ID number (Chinese only) [http://shixin.court.gov.cn/ shixin.court.gov.cn].

* '''OpenLaw China''' – A non‑profit project that aggregates publicly available court decisions from across China. Users can search by case type, keywords or court to retrieve anonymised judgments. Interface is in Chinese; registration is optional for basic search [http://openlaw.cn/ openlaw.cn].

* '''Peking University Law (PKU Law) – cases database''' – A subscription database covering judgments and legislation from all courts in China. The case search allows filtering by court level, case type or date. Limited free previews are available; full access requires a paid subscription [http://www.pkulaw.cn/Case/ pkulaw.cn].

* '''Shanghai Courts – judgment documents''' – Portal of the Shanghai High People’s Court providing judgments from courts in Shanghai since 2003. Users can search by case number or keywords in Chinese [http://www.hshfy.sh.cn/shfy/gweb201 hshfy.sh.cn].

* '''Zhaoqing court – judgment search''' – Regional portal for the Zhaoqing Intermediate and basic courts. Searches are available by case number or party name (Chinese only) [http://ssfw.gdzqfy.gov.cn/cpwsgk_li gdzqfy.gov.cn].

* '''Zhejiang courts – judgment search''' – Database of judgments from courts in Zhejiang province, searchable by case number, party name or keywords [http://www.zjsfgkw.cn/Document/Judg zjsfgkw.cn].

litigation.wiki_content:
* '''Judiciary of Colombia – case search (procesos.ramajudicial.gov.co)''' – The official judicial portal hosts a case search that allows users to query by the name of a party or by case number after selecting the relevant city and court.  Access may be restricted outside Colombia.

* '''Supreme Court of Colombia – free‑text and exact‑text judgements search''' – The Supreme Court of Justice offers two search tools: a free‑text search that returns judgments containing any of the keywords entered and an exact‑text search that returns judgments matching the exact string.  Users can search by keywords, case numbers or party names.  These sites may be accessible only within Colombia.

* '''Supreme Court of Colombia – process consultations by state''' – The Supreme Court’s process consultation portal allows users to search for cases by selecting a city and entering a surname or case number.  Results indicate the status of the process in state courts.

* '''Inter‑American Court of Human Rights – jurisprudence finder''' – The court’s jurisprudence finder database provides access to decisions, rulings and advisory opinions.  Searches can be performed by case name, country or subject matter.

* '''Disciplinary action search (Sala Disciplinaria)''' – The Judicial Branch’s Sala Disciplinaria portal offers a search for disciplinary records of judicial officials.  Users can enter a document number to retrieve information on disciplinary actions.

* '''Judicial Branch contracts''' – The Colombian Judicial Branch publishes a registry of contracts awarded.  Searches can be filtered by year and include details of the contracting entity, contract value and purpose.

corporate_registry.wiki_content:
* '''Registro Único Empresarial y Social (RUES) – national business register''' – RUES is Colombia’s central business information system operated by the network of chambers of commerce.  According to the portal, it is “la fuente de información empresarial más robusta” (the most robust source of business information) and handles over 40 million consultations a year:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.  The site includes multiple sub‑registers (mercantile, non‑profit, proponent, tourism, bond operators, foreign NGOs, cooperatives and others):contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.  Users can conduct free basic searches on the public portal by company name or identification number to verify the existence of a firm, view its registration status and obtain contact details; detailed certificates and document downloads require registration and payment.  The portal also provides guidance for searching company names (for example, trying variations and composing names to improve results):contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.

* '''Bogotá Chamber of Commerce – company search''' – The Chamber of Commerce of Bogotá (Cámara de Comercio de Bogotá) offers an online search tool for companies registered in Bogotá.  Searches can be made by company name, registration number or legal representative.  Results include the company’s status, legal form and registration details.  Access to detailed certificates usually requires a fee or registration.  The service may be unavailable from outside Colombia; use the Bogotá chamber search page [https://linea.ccb.org.co/ Bogotá chamber search] or the chamber’s main site [https://www.ccb.org.co/ Bogotá chamber home] for access.

* '''Cartagena Chamber of Commerce – business database''' – The Cartagena Chamber of Commerce (Cámara de Comercio de Cartagena) provides a business database and online consultation service.  The database contains information on companies registered in Cartagena and the northern municipalities of Bolívar.  Users can search by company name and obtain basic details such as registration number, legal form, address and status.  Access to full dossiers may require a subscription.

* '''Junta Central de Contadores – sanctioned accountants list''' – The Colombian Central Board of Accountants publishes a list of accountants sanctioned within the past five years.  The database can be searched by accountant name or identification number and includes details of the sanction and the date.  Registration may be required for full reports.

* '''National Tourism Registry (RNT) – tourism business search''' – The RNT is a public register in which all tourism service providers operating in Colombia must register.  The portal notes that it is a “registro público” and that all providers of tourism services in Colombia must register:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.  Users can search the register for exact matches of business names; results show the company’s registration number, status and contact information.  The database is operated by Confecámaras.

* '''Integrated System of Transit Fines (SIMIT)''' – SIMIT is a national system that consolidates information on traffic fines and penalties.  Citizens can search by personal identification number to check outstanding fines or sanctions.  Some information may require registration or payment.

* '''Bolsa de Valores de Colombia (BVC) – disciplinary actions and listed companies''' – The Colombian stock exchange maintains two online databases.  The disciplinary actions portal allows users to search ongoing or concluded investigations by the name of the person or firm investigated; results include the process status and resolutions.  A separate “Listado de Emisores” lists companies admitted to trading on the stock exchange; users can search by company name or ticker symbol to obtain the issuer’s registration data, industry classification and trading history.

* '''Inter‑American Development Bank (IDB) – approved projects database''' – The IDB’s transparency portal includes a searchable database of approved projects.  Searches can be filtered by keyword, project number, country, sector and status to retrieve information on project names, financing amounts, approval dates and available documents.

* '''Israel–Latin American Chamber of Commerce – members index''' – The Israel–Latin American Chamber of Commerce maintains a directory of its members.  Users can search the index by member name to find companies active in bilateral trade between Israel and Latin America.

* '''National Directorate of Copyright – registry of works''' – The Dirección Nacional de Derecho de Autor provides an online portal for the registration of works, acts and contracts.  A login is required to access registration records or to file new registrations.

* '''Procuraduría General de la Nación – delinquent debtor bulletin (BDME)''' – The State’s Delinquent Debtor Bulletin lists natural and legal persons who owe money to public entities.  Searches are performed by tax identification number.  The bulletin records debtors whose obligations exceed five times the legal minimum monthly salary and have been unpaid for more than six months.  Most information requires registration.

* '''Superintendencia de Industria y Comercio – decisions search''' – The Superintendence of Industry and Commerce offers a search tool for its decisions.  Users can search by keywords, date or case number to retrieve administrative acts relating to consumer protection, competition and industrial property.  (Site may require the use of Spanish and may be slow to load.)

* '''Páginas Amarillas (Yellow Pages) – business directory''' – Páginas Amarillas is a commercial directory covering 11 countries in Latin America.  Its Colombian portal describes itself as “el directorio comercial más grande de Latinoamérica” (the largest commercial directory in Latin America) and invites users to perform searches for businesses or services by category and location:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.  Users can search by keywords (“¿Qué buscas?”) and city (“¿Dónde?”) to find companies and contact details:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

* '''Páginas Blancas (White Pages) – telephone directory''' – The Colombian White Pages is a telephone directory for individuals and businesses.  Users must perform manual searches by name or telephone number to obtain contact details.  Access may be restricted from outside Colombia.

* '''Superintendencia de Sociedades – company oversight''' – The Superintendencia de Sociedades is the government entity that supervises commercial companies.  Its portal provides information on company dissolution processes, insolvency proceedings and administrative sanctions.  The site includes search tools for public records and communications.

* '''National Tourism Business Registration – duplicate entry''' – See the RNT description above.  This duplicate entry has been consolidated.
